title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.4. EMERGENCY RESPONSE EDUCATION

description.narrative: By end 2021, government actors, communities and NGOs in targeted zones have the capacity to prepare for and mount a coordinated response to the need for inclusive education in emergencies, in line with INEE standards, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Education In Emergencies, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By the end of 2022, the most vulnerable preschool and school-age children, adolescents and young people, of both sexes, in the 10 targeted provinces make greater use of inclusive, quality educational services, for improved learning outcomes and receive certification for this.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, government actors, communities and NGOs in targeted zones have the capacity to prepare for and mount a coordinatedresponse to the need for inclusive education in emergencies, in line with INEE standards

description.narrative: UNICEF supported resilience building by continuing support for the distance learning, the strengthening of actors in providing psychosocial support to children, the fight against gender-based violence and menstrual hygiene management, as well as supporting the community-based real-time monitoring system EduTrac, which is based on the U-Report model designed for community feedback in emergency situations. Development actions focused on the construction of classrooms, latrines and water points, the distribution of school kits, and the organization of pedagogical days. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/01/2022
